titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Susan Cataldo Papers MSS.194
titlestmt.author: Jennifer E. Neal

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-11-22 16:55:05 -0500.

physdesc.extent: in 5 record cartons; 2 manuscript boxes; 1 flat box, and 1 CD box

did.abstract: Susan Cataldo (1952-2001) was an American poet and published author. She spent most of her adult life living in the East Village in Manhattan and was involved with the Poetry Project at St. Mark's Church. This collection highlights Cataldo's career as a writer in New York City during the 1980s and 1990s. Materials include newsletters, poems, writings, manuscripts, notebooks, letters, diaries, print publications and three CD-Rs that feature recordings of Cataldo at the Poetry Project during the 1980s.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Stephen Spicehandler in 2006; additional materials were donated in 2010. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 2007.194 and 2010.194.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged in the order in which they were received by donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Susan Cataldo was born in the Bronx, New York on September 15, 1952. She spent most of her adult life living in the East Village in Manhattan and first became involved with the Poetry Project at St. Mark's Church in the late 1970s, where she participated in and lead writing workshops. Cataldo published three books of poems including "Brooklyn-Queens Day," "The Mother Journal," and "drenched." Her work has appeared in numerous poetry publications and anthologies. Cataldo passed away on April 25, 2001 from ovarian cancer.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact fales.library@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Susan Cataldo Papers; MSS 194; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in new, acid-free folders. Original folder titles were retained where applicable and orignal order was maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include monthly literary newsletters that Cataldo subscribed to; her original poems and writings; draft manuscripts of Cataldo's work; personal notebooks from different workshops and classes; sketchbooks with her drawings; letters from other poets and writers; personal diaries; copies of her published works, including the book, "drenched," that was published after her death in 2002; and three CD-Rs that feature recordings of Cataldo at The Poetry Project at St. Mark's Church during the 1980s. The bulk of the collection consists of Cataldo's personal diaries that include her thoughts, notes, sketches, and poems between 1977 and 2000. One diary in particular, located in box 2, contains Cataldo's poetry that was published in her work, "Mother Journal."

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Susan Cataldo, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
